SENT.plain: A rare case of moyamoya disease in a 9-year-old female presented with behavioural disturbances and recurrent hemiparetic attacks is reported
Moyamoya disease is an uncommon form of arteritis which affects the cerebrovascular circulation
Magnetic resonance angiography is a non-invasive technique for evaluation of the carotid and vertebrobasilar circulation
The magnetic resonance angiography findings are typical and characteristic of this disease
